content.description:
Das Gnar -straight up!

Sweetest roof in SE Wyoming. On par with Fiddler on the Roof (Fremont Canyon), Moonsault, Friday the 13th, and other classic roofcracks in Vedauwoo.

A dihedral with 1 bolt leads to a crimp traverse with one bolt. Then wild jamming into the hands roof. It narrows down to thin hands for the lip. Narrows to fingers and tips locks for the finish. Good luck!

Bolted Anchors with chains. Brand New.
content.protection:
Few finger pieces for dihedral and beginning and end of roof. Hands-thin hands for roof.

BTW, there is a 'fixed' stopper in the vertical section of the crack and a bail biner on the second bolt. These pieces are for lowering and should not be removed. (otherwise your rope might be eaten)

Also, there was a fixed piece in the horizontal section that has recently come out (i found it at the base). A small TCU can suffice in its stead.
content.location: The most southerly route on the West face of Dome Rock. On the buttress with the large white streak.

content.description: The whole Problem is a crux, technical through the first five moves then Technically sequenced and powerful last three moves. You like Crimpers, Pinches on strong smooth granite this is your style.
content.location: Its off the road just across from Dome Rock, its on private land, if you need access and directions contact me @ 307- 262- 9737 Danny B

content.description: Its a stout push to the top from start to finish, one mega sloper/dish about eight feet up to the right. terrible feet, it is however a slab climb. Be ware- water seeps from rock year round.
content.protection: Crash pads, Trad pro, TopRope sport... its an all around great mix.
content.location: Pedro Mountains south west of Dome rock.

content.description: Solid crack up a vertical face. Goes from finger to hand. Crux comes at the top out
content.protection: A few pads and a spotter. two small rocks around the landing.
content.location:
Dome Rock. Below the main part of the Dome facing away from where you walked in from.

Walk down the side after crushing it

content.description: The Problem is balancey and technical from start to finish, its a slab/friction climb with a slight overhang to the rim, follow the seam all the way through, one good crimp just before the last move, then Dyno over lip and catch a ridge/slopper... then top out.
content.protection: Crash Pads! at least two, its an evil fall.
content.location: Directly east of dome rock, it can be seen right off the road, also on privately owned land, message me for information if you want access.

content.description: Slab face on large 15ft boulder, sketchy topout through sloppers.

This is the obvious "J" crack on the far right side of the Troll Wall. Follow lower portion of the "J". If you keep your hands in the crack, this section is all about smearing. The vertical section of the "J" is a typical off-width with ample places for excellent protection. Climb past the first ledge (~110') to reach the top of the dome. (140') Descend the gully to East.
content.protection: Small nuts and cams for the first horizontal section. Then medium to large cams for the rest. Keep a few medium cams for the anchor at the top.
content.location: This route is accessed by climbing up any number of south facing wall routes to a large ledge. Most easily by climbing "Durrance Deja Vu" or "School's Out" in the large alcove on the south face.

content.description: Sweet line through a small roof and steep mantel. Nice little ab workout
content.location: The namesake route of the area, Gravy Train is located on the top of the third set of rocks to the right at the top of the Dome.

content.description: Simple crack that starts on the right side of the large alcove. An assortment of climbing techniques can be used. Stemming at the beginning leads to more typical crack climbing techniques. Top out on a large ledge system below the Troll Wall. No real cruxes on this route. Use this route to reach the routes on the Troll Wall.
content.protection: Medium to large cams will find excellent homes on this well protected route. Keep a few medium to large cams for the anchor at the top.
content.location: This route is located in a large alcove on the south face. Either continue up the Troll wall then walk down the gully or rap down the chains on the far east end of the large ledge.

content.description: Stick with the crack, don't use the slab! Knee bar your way up and conquer the Waffels
content.location: At the Gravy Train area on Dome Rock. One of the first cracks you see when you get up there.
